title: Eastleach Walks

images.title: Saffron Blaze, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: St Michael and St Martin's Church is a redundant Anglican church in Eastleach Martin, Gloucestershire, England. It has been designated by English Heritage as a Grade I listed building, and is under the care of the Churches Conservation Trust. The church stands close to the River Leach which divides Eastleach Martin from its twin village of Eastleach Turville. Eastleach Turville's Church of St Andrew stands only 180 metres away from the Church of St Michael and St Martin.

images.caption: Stone slab clapper footbridge that crosses the River Leach. The bridge allows people to cross from Eastleach Turville to Eastleach Martin.

images.title: The Mill House, Southrop, Gloucestershire by Oswald Bertram, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Mill House, Southrop, Gloucestershire

description: This Gloucestershire village includes the settlements of Eastleach Turville and Eastleach Martin which sit either side of the River Leach. It's an historic place with two Norman churches and an ancient stone slab clapper footbridge over the river. All in all there are over 60 listed buildings across the two villages. The picture postcard settlement is also known for its display of daffodils in the spring and a very fine 18th century pub. This walk explores the two settlements before heading south through the countryside to visit neighbouring Southrop. It's another attractive place with an 11th century church and a series of old stone cottages to admire. To continue your walking in the area head south to visit Lechlade where you can enjoy a riverside walk along the Thames Path National Trail.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Back in the village you can enjoy some post walk refreshments at The Victoria Inn. The building dates back to the early 18th century when it was formerly a private house complete with an attached coach house. They serve high quality dishes which you can enjoy in the outdoor seating area with a view of the village.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: A few miles to the west there's the beauitful Cotswolds village of Bibury where you can enjoy walks along the River Coln and visit the famous Arlington Row.
